item.title: C-EP CONSUMER SERVICES
item.description: C-EP CONSUMER SERVICES Service Design | 2017, Professiona Work DESIGN QUESTION: How should the role of an energy company change with focusing on a customer experience? In 2016, the deregulation of the electric power industry in Japan started on a full scale and a lot of emerging companies have been entering into the electtricity market. Chubu Electric Power Company (C-EPCO) must shift to a new paradigm of customer service to improve their retention capability.

item.title: FUTURE SUPERMARKET DESIGN INAGEYA
item.description: FUTURE SUPERMARKET DESIGN INAGEYA Business Design | 2016, Professional Work Design Question: What is “beyond” supermarket? In a situation that society and family structures are changing, a role of supermarket also needs to change in Japan. Clients were struggling for planning a strong concept of a next-generation supermarket in 2020 with consideration for a sustainable ecosystem and of course customer-first. Design Thinking: Dive into “the customer” Using IBM Design Thinking, we supported to ideate a brand-new future user experience and defined the concept of next-gen supermarket only in 2 days intensive design camp.

item.title: Uber UX RESEARCH AND DESIGN
item.description: UBER UX RESEARCH AND DESIGN UX/UI Design | 2015, Academic Work Design Question: How can we improve the experience of Uber drivers? Joined 5 weeks MFA Interaction Design Program of User Research Methods in SVA, US. Woriking in teams, we’ve joined a real project with Uber and proposed UX to solve current issues. I’ve learned the fundamentals of user research techniques and the sense of UX in collaboration with global students.

item.title: Daifuku Experience
item.description: DAIFUKU EXPERIENCE UX/UI Design | 2015, Professiona Work Design Question: How do we build awareness for a global unified brand? Clients thought their website was becoming obsolete and wanted to enhance their brand using current web technologies and user-centered disciplines. And Daifuku has 20 branches in the world, so they wanted to provide global integrated contents and operations. Our Approach: Service Ecosystem Design Based on a service design approach, we designed and proposed from a business organization to UX / UI and an infrastructure.

item.title: LimpiDual Touch
item.description: LIMPIDUAL TOUCH Interaction Design | 2009, Academic Work Design Question: If we can display information on a transparent surface, how will our experience change? Direct-touch input enables intuitive operation, and touch panels have been mounted on various devices. However, finger occlusion becomes one of the problems when a user touches the display from the front side. Here, inspired from SF movies, one idea to solve this problem is to use “transparent” display.

item.title: Speculative Thinking
item.description: Speculative Thinking Design Research | 2016, Personal Work Speculative Fusion of Design and Science Phase: Design Research Period: 01/2018 Team: Sole Project Role: Researcher What I did: Visualize my research Method: IBM Design Thinking This is my own thought of the speculative fusion of design and science. In the business field, we have been creating probable futures using industrial solutions. Currently, through a collaboration with designers, technologists and business strategists, we can imagine and develop further plausible futures based on emerging technologies.

item.title: IBM Watson cognitive enterprise app
item.description: IBM Watson cognitive enterprise app Enterprise Application Design | 2016, Professional Work Design Question: How can MHI engineers make the RFP inspection process more effectively? RFP inspection is important work for Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, Ltd. (MHI) engineers to estimate risks in advance and deliver the project in a healthy way. However, it needs much knowledge and takes long time to do it accurately under the pressure of a deadline.

item.title: IBM Corporate Service Corps
item.description: IBM Corporate Service Corps Business Strategy Design | 2014, Professional Work Design Question: How do we establish a preferable future vision on a social level? IBM CSC(Corporate Service Corp) is one-month pro bono consulting program for developing countries addressing Energy, Economic Development, Transportation, Education, and Healthcare. I participated in the IBM pro bono Corporate Service Corps, addressing social issues in developing countries. I was one of a cross-border global IBM team in Mexico that sought to tackle the problems of gender violence by collaborating with the Mexico State Public Administration.
